title: How Rosie Eccles overcame Deliveroo and cleaning schools to pursue her Olympic boxing dream
text:
From the very first moment she set foot in a boxercise class as a 15-year-old, Rosie Eccles knew she was destined for a career in the ring. The teenager from Caldicot, south Wales, kept returning on one condition: that the instructor would take her down to the local boxing gym in Newport when she turned 16.

“I saved up and bought a moped. I’d go to bed in my clothes, wake up and sneak out the back door and ride to Newport to box, which was 40 minutes away,” said Eccles.

“It was freezing. I’d box, ride back, go to sleep for ten minutes and then get up and go to school. I was completely hooked. I did it for a good few months before I got caught.”

Despite previous warnings, it was her father who discovered Eccles and her Yamaha moped were missing one fateful morning after an impromptu 4am visit at the house where she lived with her mother. A subsequent ‘ban’ ensued, but by then the damage was done and the pair now laugh whenever the subject is brought up.

“Since I was a kid, my goal was literally to go to the Olympics, I just never knew it would be boxing. ” said Eccles. “It’s kind of surreal because it’s the closest I’ve ever been to that. When I was a kid in that boxercise class, I knew that’s what I wanted to do, it sounds cheesy, but it did genuinely feel that way.”
